title: Hyundai Motor India December sales down 2.4 pc at 55,078 units - The Economic Times
summary:
Hyundai Motor India December Sales Decline 2.4% to 55,078 Units

Last Updated: Jan 01, 2025, 02:36 PM IST Source: PTI

Hyundai Motor India Ltd reported a 2.4% decline in total sales for December 2024, with 55,078 units sold compared to 56,450 units in December 2023. Nevertheless, the company achieved its highest-ever yearly domestic sales in 2024.

  • December total sales: 55,078 units, down 2.4% YoY.
  • Domestic sales for December: 42,208 units, down 1.3% YoY.
  • Exports in December: 12,870 units, down 6.1% YoY.
  • Record yearly domestic sales: 6,05,433 units in 2024.
  • SUV contribution to total sales: 67.6% in 2024.
"Achieving highest-ever domestic sales three years in a row reflects customers' preference for brand Hyundai as their trusted smart mobility solutions provider," said Tarun Garg, HMIL Whole-time Director and COO.

The overall sales in 2024 were marginally lower at 7,64,119 units compared to 7,65,786 units in 2023.
newTitle: Hyundai Motor India December Sales Decline 2.4% to 55,078 Units

Stock to buy in 2025: Motilal Oswal sees 20% upside in Rekha Jhunjhunwala portfolio stock Metro Brands; here's why | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Metro Brands Stock Projected for 20% Upside in 2025, According to Motilal Oswal

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Metro Brands, part of Rekha Jhunjhunwala’s portfolio, is expected to see a turnaround in 2025 with a projected 20% return according to Motilal Oswal. The brokerage attributes this potential growth to robust store economics and efficient operations.

Metro Brands Share Target Price

MOSL has set a target price of ₹1,460 for Metro Brands, indicating a potential upside of 20.46%.

Challenges in 2024

Despite facing internal and external challenges in 2024, Metro Brands maintained strong margin control, with gross margins at 57% and PAT margins at 14%.

Key Investment Rationale

  • Growth Potential: FILA and Foot Locker expected to contribute significantly to revenue.
  • Store Economics: Sales per square foot at ₹20,000 with a two-year payback period.
  • Expansion Plans: Aiming for presence in 300 cities with robust internal funding.

MOSL’s Valuation Metrics

MOSL values Metro Brands at 70 times its December 2026 P/E ratio, predicting steady growth in revenue and margins.

Disclaimer: Investment advice should be verified with certified experts.
newTitle: Metro Brands Stock Projected for 20% Upside in 2025, According to Motilal Oswal

title: Suzlon Energy share price rises 4% post various business updates | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Suzlon Energy Share Price Rises 4% Post Various Business Updates

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Livemint

In morning trades on Wednesday, Suzlon Energy’s share price increased by up to 4% following announcements regarding business updates, including rating upgrades and penalty cancellations.

Key Points

  • CRISIL upgraded the ratings for SE Forge Ltd, a subsidiary of Suzlon, improving its long-term rating from 'CRISIL BBB- / Stable' to 'CRISIL BBB+ / Positive'.
  • The total loan facilities rated by CRISIL for SE Forge Ltd is ₹205.45 crore.
  • National Faceless Penalty Centre's penalty of ₹260.35 crore for FY 2015-16 and FY 2016-17 was cancelled.
  • Suzlon Energy's share price opened at ₹62.89 on the BSE, reaching a peak of ₹64.67 during intraday trading.
  • Despite past corrections, the stock is still up more than six times compared to two years ago.
  • CEO S. Venkata Subramaniam announced resignation effective December 31, 2024.
"The stock has given multibagger returns to investors over the past two years."

In conclusion, the positive updates regarding rating upgrades and the cancellation of penalties have contributed to a rise in Suzlon Energy's share price, attracting investor interest.
newTitle: Suzlon Energy Share Price Rises 4% Following Positive Business Updates

Honda Activa e: and QC1 electric scooter bookings officially open - BikeWale
summary:
Honda Opens Bookings for Activa e: and QC1 Electric Scooters in India

Date & Source: Publication Date Unknown

Honda has officially opened bookings for its new electric scooters, the Activa e: and QC1, in select Indian cities, requiring a booking fee of Rs 1,000.

  • Bookings are now available in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, and other cities.
  • The Activa e: is Honda’s first electric vehicle for India, featuring modern technology and performance specs.
  • The scooter comes with swappable batteries, boasting a range of 102 km on a single charge.
  • The QC1 is a budget-friendly option with lower performance specifications.
“Honda claims that the Activa e: can go from 0-60 km/h in just 7.3 seconds.”

Honda plans to launch a network of battery swapping stations across India, with deliveries of the scooters expected to start in February.
newTitle: Honda Opens Bookings for Activa e: and QC1 Electric Scooters in India

title: Easy Trip Planners share price down as CEO Nishant Pitti resigns citing personal reasons - Upstox
summary:
Easy Trip Planners share price down as CEO Nishant Pitti resigns citing personal reasons

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: Easy Trip Planners News

Nishant Pitti has resigned as CEO of Easy Trip Planners due to personal reasons and has divested a 1.4% stake in the company.

  • Nishant Pitti's resignation is effective from January 01, 2025.
  • He divested a 1.4% stake for ₹78 crore, reducing his holding to 12.8%.
  • Rikant Pittie has been appointed as the new CEO of EasyMyTrip.
  • Easy Trip Planners' share price fell to ₹15.76, a 0.6% decline.
  • Pitti's previous divestment was a 14% stake for ₹920 crore in September 2023.
“The travel industry is at a transformative juncture where technology and personalisation are redefining how people explore the world,” said Rikant Pittie upon his appointment.

This change in leadership marks a significant adjustment for Easy Trip Planners as it continues to navigate the evolving travel market.
newTitle: Easy Trip Planners share price down as CEO Nishant Pitti resigns citing personal reasons

title: Nifty IT vs Nifty FMCG: Which index to pick in 2025? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Nifty IT vs Nifty FMCG: Which Index to Choose for 2025?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

When it comes to long-term investments, selecting the right sector is crucial for ensuring both returns and portfolio stability. The debate between the Nifty IT and Nifty FMCG indices has garnered considerable attention among industry experts, each offering distinct perspectives on which index presents a superior long-term investment opportunity.

Index Price Trends: A Comparative Analysis

In 2024, Nifty IT gained 22%, while Nifty FMCG dropped by 0.33%. Over the last three years, however, Nifty FMCG rose 51% compared to a 12% increase in Nifty IT.

Nifty IT vs Nifty FMCG: Where to invest?

Industry experts favor the IT sector due to its growth driven by digital transformation and Generative AI.

Challenges for the FMCG Sector

The FMCG sector is facing challenges due to weak demand and inflationary pressures.

A Balanced Approach: IT for Growth, FMCG for Stability

Investors are advised to consider their goals; the IT sector offers better growth potential, while FMCG stocks provide stability and steady returns.

“Indian IT companies are well-established players in the global market, with strong order books and cash flows that offer reliable returns.” - Sujit Modi, CIO of Share.Market
newTitle: Nifty IT vs Nifty FMCG: Which Index to Choose for 2025?

title: Nishant Pitti steps down as Easy Trip Planners CEO; Rikant Pittie takes the helm | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners; Rikant Pittie Appointed as New CEO

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Easy Trip Planners recently announced the resignation of Nishant Pitti as CEO, effective January 1, and the appointment of Rikant Pittie, previously CFO, as the new CEO.

  • Nishant Pitti resigned for personal reasons.
  • Rikant Pittie is promoted to CEO from CFO; he is also Nishant's brother.
  • Nishant sold a 1.4% stake in the company for ₹78 crore prior to his resignation.
  • Rikant Pittie holds a significant stake in the company, amounting to 25.88%.
  • Easy Trip Planners is the parent company of EaseMyTrip.
Nishant Pitti offloaded 4,99,52,163 shares at an average price of ₹15.68, realizing a transaction value of ₹78.32 crore.

The transition in leadership at Easy Trip Planners marks a significant shift in the company's management, with the new CEO expected to steer the company into its next phase of growth.
newTitle: Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners; Rikant Pittie Appointed as New CEO

title: Nishant Pitti, Co-promoter of EaseMyTrip, resigns as CEO with immediate effect, cites personal reasons - CNBCTV18
summary:
Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Nishant Pitti, a co-promoter of Easy Trip Planners, has resigned from his position as CEO, citing personal reasons.

  • Pitti had planned to sell his remaining 14% stake in the company but only managed to sell 1.4% on Tuesday.
  • He has been associated with the company since 2008 and was re-appointed for a five-year term in May 2024.
  • Rikant Pittie has been appointed as the new CEO, effective immediately.
  • Retail shareholding in Easy Trip Planners has increased significantly since its IPO in 2021.
“Dear Board Members, I, Nishant Pitti, hereby tender my resignation from the position of CEO due to personal reasons with effect from January 01, 2025.”

The resignation comes amidst ongoing stake sale activities by Pitti, who previously sold shares to retail investors.
newTitle: Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners

title: IREDA shares rally 6% as Q3 loan disbursement jumps 41% - The Economic Times
December Auto Sales: Bajaj Auto shares fall after December sales miss estimates - CNBCTV18
summary:
December Auto Sales: Bajaj Auto shares fall after December sales miss estimates

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Bajaj Auto's sales data for December has led to a drop in its shares, as the company fell short of market expectations. Total sales reported were 3.23 lakh units, an overall decline of 1% year-on-year, compared to the anticipated 3.55 lakh units.

  • Domestic sales decreased by 15% year-on-year to 1.62 lakh units.
  • Exports increased by 18% year-on-year to 1.60 lakh units.
  • Two-wheeler segment sales fell by 4%, totaling 2.72 lakh units.
  • Three-wheeler segment sales increased by 16%, with 50,952 units sold.
  • Bajaj Auto's electric two-wheeler segment holds a strong market share of 25%.
  • Brokerage Emkay Global upgraded Bajaj Auto's rating from 'Sell' to 'Add', with a price target of ₹9,500.
“The stock has declined over 30% from its recent peak of ₹12,774.”

In conclusion, while Bajaj Auto's export performance is strong, the decline in domestic sales and overall sales underperformance raise concerns about its current market position.
newTitle: Bajaj Auto Shares Dip as December Sales Fall Short of Expectations

title: Multibagger stock IREDA share price jumps 6% post business updates; loan book sees 36% growth | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
IREDA Share Price Surges 6% Following Strong Business Updates

Date: January 1, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) saw its share price jump nearly 6% following the release of provisional business updates indicating strong loan book growth.

Business Updates

  • Loan book growth of 36% till December 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • Loans sanctioned worth ₹31,087 crore, representing a 129% increase over ₹13,558 crore in the same period of 2023.
  • Loan disbursements at ₹17,236 crore, a 41% rise compared to ₹12,220 crore the previous year.
  • The outstanding loan book reached ₹69,000 crore, up from ₹50,580 crore in December 2023.

Stock Price Impact

IREDA's share price rose 5.83% to ₹227.70, reflecting positive market response despite having corrected from all-time highs.

Notable Quotes

“Though IREDA share price has corrected significantly from its all-time highs, it still rose 105% in 2024, delivering multibagger returns to its investors.”

The article highlights IREDA's role as a significant financial body in renewable energy and energy efficiency, established in 1987.

Conclusion

IREDA's robust performance and share price increase exemplify its growth in a challenging market, providing valuable returns to investors.
newTitle: IREDA Share Price Surges 6% Following Strong Business Updates

title: ITC Hotels Listing: Will the demerged entity become a part of MSCI, FTSE indices? - CNBCTV18
summary:
ITC Hotels Listing: Will the Demerged Entity Join MSCI and FTSE Indices?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Hotels Ltd., the new hotels business formed by the demerger from ITC Ltd., is preparing for its stock market debut, with analysts predicting its potential inclusion in various market indices.

  • The MSCI plans to temporarily add ITC Hotels as a detached security to their Global Standard Indexes as of January 6.
  • ITC Hotels may qualify for the MSCI Global Smallcap Indexes based on current estimates.
  • The FTSE has yet to announce its stance on the incorporation of ITC Hotels into its indices.
  • ITC Hotels is expected to have a market entry price between ₹150 - ₹175 per share.
Nuvama Alternative expects the share price adjustment post-demerger to be between ₹22 - ₹25 per share.

This listing and potential index inclusion could have significant implications for the valuation and market strategy of ITC Hotels.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Listing: Will the Demerged Entity Join MSCI and FTSE Indices?
